item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Fair coins tend to land on the side they started: Evidence from 350,757 flips (109 points | 60 comments)
2. A subtle layout bug in Google Search: When CJK text-wrapping meets float (7 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: Rust library for numerical integration of real-valued functions (55 points | 9 comments)
4. Why I hate the index finger (1980) (34 points | 10 comments)
5. How to Build a Chess Engine and Fail (37 points | discuss)
6. Shift Left Is the Tip of the Iceberg (36 points | 4 comments)
7. X's Moonshot for Circularity (6 points | 1 comment)
8. OpenStreetMap's New Vector Tiles (201 points | 57 comments)
9. A joke in approximating numbers raised to irrational powers (15 points | 1 comment)
10. Show HN: Embed an SQLite database in your PostgreSQL table (100 points | 54 comments)
11. Austen and Darwin converged on the question of beauty (16 points | 3 comments)
12. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (494 points | 262 comments)
13. Rim/Blackberry tales – reply all (89 points | 28 comments)
14. Show HN: FastGraphRAG – Better RAG using good old PageRank (380 points | 93 comments)
15. Expand.ai (YC S24) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer to Turn the Web into an API ( | hide)
16. Scientific American's departing editor and the politicization of science (260 points | 397 comments)
17. Maslow 4: Large format CNC routing made accessible (180 points | 55 comments)
18. 20 years of Google Scholar (361 points | 149 comments)
19. Uno Platform Studio Featuring Hot Design (15 points | 4 comments)
20. Two undersea cables in Baltic Sea disrupted (408 points | 682 comments)
21. A Woman Who Defined the Great Depression (32 points | 7 comments)
22. DOJ will push Google to sell off Chrome (874 points | 973 comments)
23. Gliimly is a programming language for web services (41 points | 46 comments)
24. MailCatcher runs a super simple SMTP server (264 points | 85 comments)
25. Hyperfine: A command-line benchmarking tool (181 points | 36 comments)
26. The tragedy of running an old Node project (176 points | 253 comments)
27. Sequin: A powerful little tool for inspecting ANSI escape sequences (78 points | 27 comments)
28. Museum of Bad Art (190 points | 132 comments)
29. A BBC navigation bar component broke depending on the external monitor (276 points | 115 comments)
30. Air traffic failure caused by two locations 3600nm apart sharing 3-letter code (252 points | 250 comments)
